dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2017, the Trump sons, Eric and Don Jr., had to scrap their hotel expansion plans in America's heartland.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty seventeen, the Trump sons, Eric and Don Jr., had to scrap their hotel expansion plans in America's heartland.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But their planstorm into Americas heartland with two new licensed hotel brandsdied earlier this year after failing to gain traction. Added Don Jr.: When politics are over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious properties in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was a big shift from their usual strategy, right? They were really hamstrung by their father's pledge not to do new foreign deals while in office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was a big shift from their usual strategy, right? They were really hamstrung by their father's pledge not to do new foreign deals while in office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That forced the kids, hamstrung by their fathers pledge not to expand internationally while in office, to pursue a very un-Trumpian strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it's interesting—they've been selling off properties quietly. Over a hundred small transactions, totaling $108 million since the inauguration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it's interesting-they've been selling off properties quietly. Over a hundred small transactions, totaling one hundred eight dollars million since the inauguration.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since their fathers inauguration, they have sold off $110 million of the presidents real estate holdingsthrough more than 100 tiny transactions that have mostly flown under the radar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Um, and some of those sales seem pretty questionable, like the land in the Dominican Republic for $3.3 million. That definitely feels like it violated the spirit of that pledge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Um, and some of those sales seem pretty questionable, like the land in the Dominican Republic for three point three dollars million. That definitely feels like it violated the spirit of that pledge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Dominican Republic, the younger Trumps sold a piece of land in January 2018 for $3.2 million. It was the clearest violation of their fathers pledge to do no new foreign deals while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And then there's the sale of the Indonesian-linked buyer for the Beverly Hills mansion—$13.6 million. It just raises eyebrows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And then there's the sale of the Indonesian-linked buyer for the Beverly Hills mansion-thirteen point six dollars million. It just raises eyebrows.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They sold Trumps mansion in Beverly Hills for $13.5 million to a company tied to Indonesian billionaire (and Trump business partner) Hary Tanoesoedibjo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and don't even get me started on the Spring Creek Towers deal. Ben Carson had to approve a sale that paid Trump an estimated $32 million? That's awkward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and don't even get me started on the Spring Creek Towers deal. Ben Carson had to approve a sale that paid Trump an estimated thirty two dollars million? That's awkward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That put Trumps subordinate in the awkward position of having to green-light a transaction that paid his boss an estimated $33 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But despite all this selling, they're not reinvesting much. Just minor updates and one big purchase—that $18.7 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lago from their aunt.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But despite all this selling, they're not reinvesting much. Just minor updates and one big purchase-that eighteen point seven dollars million mansion next to Mar-a-Lago from their aunt.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But theyve really made only one new purchase, buying an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lagofrom their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and fellow real estate folks in New York have noticed. David Walentas said Trump isn't really a developer anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and fellow real estate folks in New York have noticed. David Walentas said Trump isn't really a developer anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hes not really a real estate developer anymore, Brooklyn billionaire David Walentas told Forbes earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Instead, they're paying down debt—like $62 million since 2017. At 40 Wall Street alone, they wiped out around $20 million in liabilities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Instead, they're paying down debt-like sixty two dollars million since twenty seventeen. At forty Wall Street alone, they wiped out around twenty dollars million in liabilities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration. In New York, they wiped out roughly $19 million of liabilities at 40 Wall Street, 6 East 57th Street and 502 Park Avenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a conservative approach, especially when you consider the president's net worth has dropped $400 million since he took office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a conservative approach, especially when you consider the president's net worth has dropped four hundred dollars million since he took office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president is worth $3.1 billion (good for No. 275 on The Forbes 400), the same as a year ago and down $400 million from when he took office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But they're sitting on cash, waiting for politics to be over, like Don Jr. said. "We will resume building the best properties."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they're sitting on cash, waiting for politics to be over, like Don Jr. said. We will resume building the best properties.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Added Don Jr.: When politics are over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious properties in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, though you wonder if their brand will ever fully recover from all this scrutiny.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, though you wonder if their brand will ever fully recover from all this scrutiny.
